2018 DESCRIPTION: Housing in structures with 10 or more units estimate, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: Estimate; UNITS IN STRUCTURE - Total housing units - 10 to 19 units + Estimate; UNITS IN STRUCTURE - Total housing units - 20 or more units

2018 DESCRIPTION: Housing in structures with 10 or more units estimate MOE, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: SQRT (MOE UNITS IN STRUCTURE - Total housing units - 10 to 19 units^2 + MOE; UNITS IN STRUCTURE - Total housing units - 20 or more units^2)

2018 DESCRIPTION: At household level (occupied housing units), more people than rooms estimate MOE, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: SQRT (MOE OCCUPANTS PER ROOM - Occupied housing units - 1.01 to 1.50^2+ MOE OCCUPANTS PER ROOM - Occupied housing units - 1.51 or more^2)

Percentage of persons aged 65 and older estimate, 2014-2018 ACS
Percentage of persons aged 65 and older estimate MOE, 2014-2018 ACS
Percentage of persons aged 17 and younger estimate, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: (Persons aged 17 and younger estimate / Total population estimate) * 100
NOTES: This calculation resulted in some division by 0 errors in cases where E_TOTPOP equals 0. These rows were revised with the estimated proportions set to 0 and their corresponding MOEs set to -999.

2018 DESCRIPTION: Percentage of persons aged 17 and younger estimate MOE, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: ((SQRT(MOE Population under 18 years^2 - (Estimated proportion of persons aged 17 and younger^2 * MOE Total Population^2))) / Total population estimate) * 100
NOTES: Some MOE calculations resulted in errors because the value under the square root was negative. For these rows, as the Census Bureau suggests, we used the formula for derived ratios, as opposed to that for derived proportions. Instead of the subtraction in the standard formula, we add. See A Compass for Understanding and Using American Community Survey Data, page A-15 (https://www.census.gov/content/dam/Census/library/publications/2008/acs/ACSGeneralHandbook.pdf).

2018 DESCRIPTION: Percentage of civilian noninstitutionalized population with a disability estimate, 2014-2018 ACS
Percentage of civilian noninstitutionalized population with a disability estimate MOE, 2014-2018 ACS
Percentage of single parent households with children under 18 estimate, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: (Single parent household with children under 18 estimate / Households estimate) * 100
NOTES: This calculation resulted in some division by 0 errors in cases where E_HH equals 0. These rows were revised with the estimated proportions set to 0 and their corresponding MOEs set to -999.

2018 DESCRIPTION: Percentage of single parent households with children under 18 estimate MOE, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: ((SQRT(MOE Single parent households^2 - (Estimated proportion single parent households^2 * MOE Households^2))) / Households estimate) * 100
NOTES: Some MOE calculations resulted in errors because the value under the square root was negative. For these rows, as the Census Bureau suggests, we used the formula for derived ratios, as opposed to that for derived proportions. Instead of the subtraction in the standard formula, we add. See A Compass for Understanding and Using American Community Survey Data, page A-15 (https://www.census.gov/content/dam/Census/library/publications/2008/acs/ACSGeneralHandbook.pdf).

2018 DESCRIPTION: Percentage minority (all persons except white, non-Hispanic) estimate, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: (Minority estimate / Total population estimate) * 100
NOTES: This calculation resulted in some division by 0 errors in cases where E_HH equals 0. These rows were revised with the estimated proportions set to 0 and their corresponding MOEs set to -999.

2018 DESCRIPTION: Percentage minority (all persons except white, non-Hispanic) estimate MOE, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: ((SQRT(MOE Minority^2 - (Estimated proportion minority^2 * MOE Total population^2))) / Total population estimate) * 100

2018 DESCRIPTION: Percentage of persons (age 5+) who speak English "less than well" estimate, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: (Persons who speak English "less than well" estimate / Population age 5 and over estimate) * 100
NOTES: This calculation resulted in some division by 0 errors in cases where total population age 5 and over equals 0. These rows were revised with the estimated proportions set to 0 and their corresponding MOEs set to -999.

2018 DESCRIPTION: Percentage of persons (age 5+) who speak English "less than well" estimate MOE, 2014-2018 ACS
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: ((SQRT(MOE Persons who speak English less than well^2 - (Estimated proportion persons who speak English less than well^2 * MOE population age 5 and over^2))) / Population age 5 and over estimate) * 100
NOTES: Some MOE calculations resulted in errors because the value under the square root was negative. For these rows, as the Census Bureau suggests, we used the formula for derived ratios, as opposed to that for derived proportions. Instead of the subtraction in the standard formula, we add. See A Compass for Understanding and Using American Community Survey Data, page A-15 (https://www.census.gov/content/dam/Census/library/publications/2008/acs/ACSGeneralHandbook.pdf).

2018 DESCRIPTION: Percentage of housing in structures with 10 or more units estimate
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: (Housing in structures with 10 or more units estimate / Housing units estimate)*100
NOTES: This calculation resulted in some division by 0 errors in cases where E_HU equals 0. These rows were revised with the estimated proportions set to 0 and their corresponding MOEs set to -999.

2018 DESCRIPTION: Percentage of housing in structures with 10 or more units estimate MOE
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: ((SQRT(MOE Housing in structures with 10 or more units^2 - (Estimated proportion housing in structures with 10 or more units^2 * MOE Housing units^2))) / Housing units estimate) * 100
NOTES: Some MOE calculations resulted in errors because the value under the square root was negative. For these rows, as the Census Bureau suggests, we used the formula for derived ratios, as opposed to that for derived proportions. Instead of the subtraction in the standard formula, we add. See A Compass for Understanding and Using American Community Survey Data, page A-15 (https://www.census.gov/content/dam/Census/library/publications/2008/acs/ACSGeneralHandbook.pdf).

2018 DESCRIPTION: Percentage of occupied housing units with more people than rooms estimate MOE
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: ((SQRT(MOE Occupied housing units with more people than rooms^2 - (Estimated proportion of occupied housing units with more people than rooms^2 * MOE Occupied housing units^2))) /Occupied housing units estimate) * 100
NOTES: Some MOE calculations resulted in errors because the value under the square root was negative. For these rows, as the Census Bureau suggests, we used the formula for derived ratios, as opposed to that for derived proportions. Instead of the subtraction in the standard formula, we add. See A Compass for Understanding and Using American Community Survey Data, page A-15 (https://www.census.gov/content/dam/Census/library/publications/2008/acs/ACSGeneralHandbook.pdf).

2018 DESCRIPTION: Adjunct variable - Uninsured in the total civilian noninstitutionalized population estimate, 2014-2018 ACS
Adjunct variable - Uninsured in the total civilian noninstitutionalized population estimate MOE, 2014-2018 ACS
Adjunct variable - Percentage uninsured in the total civilian noninstitutionalized population estimate, 2014-2018 ACS
Adjunct variable - Percentage uninsured in the total civilian noninstitutionalized population estimate MOE, 2014-2018 ACS
Adjunct variable - Estimated daytime population, LandScan 2018
CALCULATION DESCRIPTION: Derived from LandScan 2018 - http://web.ornl.gov/sci/landscan/index.shtml. We followed ORNL's instructions for processing in ArcGIS, loading the LandScan grid first and maintaining WGS84 projection parameters. Using Spatial Analyst, we ran the Zonal Statistics as Table function to sum estimated daytime population for each LandScan raster cell to obtain an estimated daytime population for each SVI 2018 census tract.
NOTES: Tracts having no LandScan cells that overlay have been assigned null values (i.e. -999).
LandScan daytime populations are unavailable for Puerto Rico, therefore all Puerto Rico tracts and municipios are assigned -999.
